posts.title: The Adventures of Captain Sprill Part Four
posts.author: cwmoon
posts.summary: Captain Sprill thought he knew what they meant.  So he nodded.  But when he got there, he realized he’d been wrong.  Wrong in many different ways.

posts.title: The Adventures of Captain Sprill Part Three
posts.author: cwmoon
posts.summary: “Oh Master Hinchcliffe, dead reckoning is for fools and pirates. Tsk tsk,” he tutted his tongue and trotted in a waddle to the stern, “On my mark!” His hand pointed to the sky.  He threw the wooden chip over and dropped his arm when he heard a splash. Rolling his eyes, Hinchcliffe flipped the sand timer.

posts.title: The Adventures of Captain Sprill Part Two
posts.author: cwmoon
posts.summary: This boat is our family’s fortune floating.  We’ve found the best craftsmen, materials from the most trusted trade markets, and designs from straight from Shipwright James of the Northern Tide.  Lioness will carry you as far as the end of the world. We owe many people many debts from the building of this vessel.

posts.title: The Adventures of Captain Sprill Part One
posts.author: cwmoon
posts.summary: Crossroads, narrow roads, and other decisions that involve turning. There are no right turns, but there can be wrong ones. There is a reason navigators were paid royally to help ships cross the Atlantic.  Who is your navigator?

posts.title: A Place To Start
posts.author: cwmoon
posts.summary: I've contemplated starting a blog for three years now and my biggest regret is not starting sooner. When I was first making the decision to bring my thoughts to the internet, I felt overwhelmed by the mounds of publishing options. WordPress, Squarespace, GoDaddy, Oh My!
